question: Which are the two countries involved in the "Wenamu territorial dispute"?
explanation: Venezuela and Guyana are the two countries involved in the "Wenamu territorial dispute". The Wenamu has been a part of the long territorial dispute between Guyana and Venezuela. In 2007, Venezuelan troops used C-4 (explosive) to destroy mining dredges illegally in their territory. The Wenamu is also a crossing point for Venezuelan refugees entering Guyana.
